title: Programme Evaluation for Policy Analysis
abstractText:
This project funds a node of the National Centre for Research Methods called Programme Evaluation for Policy Analysis (PEPA), based at the Institute for Fiscal Studies. 

The objectives of this node are to stimulate a step change in the conduct of programme evaluation, and to maximise the value of programme evaluation by improving the design of evaluations and improving the way that such evaluations add to the knowledge base. This will be achieved through research into programme evaluation methods, a range of training and capacity building activities, and a set of substantive applications which will serve as exemplars in the field.  

The work of the node will be organised around 5 projects: a Reassessment of the ERA, Improving Inference for Policy Evaluation, Control Functions in Policy Evaluation, Combining Quasi-experimental Methods with Dynamic Behavioural Models, Social Networks and Programme Evaluation. 

Beneficiaries will include:

  • researchers who undertake programme evaluations
  • policy-makers who commission and interpret evaluations
  • those interested in the labour market
  • education and health policies that we will study in our substantive applications
  •  the public, who will benefit as the techniques developed and promoted by this Node lead to better policies.
